data.title: Scatter Sky Community Fixes 17 April
Steps on the way to Linux client support.
data.body:
This is really just getting compilation to work, I haven't done much else.  My system lacks a full 32bit development environment, but I can get up to linking with this.  Some commits in here (type stuff) set the stage so that 64bit compilation can proceed on Linux, which is probably where I'll move next.

There's some types/code in x86UNIXOGLVideo.h that got added just to make things compile. The "Resolution" struct for example; "DisplayDevice" too.  It seems like these _should_ exist elsewhere in Torque, but I couldn't find them.  Or perhaps there was an API update long ago, and this whole directory was bitrotting?  I would appreciate some guidance/input/help here!

just-bank had some patches posted in:
   http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132085
that never made it in.  I tried to use "author" to attribute those properly, but I might have mixed things up a bit.  Happy to change things if someone can point out where I've made mistakes.

The 3 other commits by other authors exist in GG/Torque3D's "master" but not in "development", so I managed to pull them along for the ride.  They seem like they should actually be in development too, anyway, so I left them in.

data.title: Shapebase fix for repairs
data.body: Expanded if check

data.title: Compiling with VS2012
Elastic ease:  incorrectly uses arcsin, should be sin
data.body: Fix was presented in pull request #200, but was incorrectly based on the master branch.

data.title: Default to an empty field for cubemap in the river and other water objec...
data.body: ...t builder script.

data.title: Shapebase fix for repairs
data.body: Minor fix to make sure that a dead player isn't healed by adding a check to mDamageState in the if check/

data.title: Static culling of objects in camera view.
data.body: This resource optimizes the rendering of a scene by doing a Frustum check to make sure the object is visible from the camera before rendering it, thus increasing frame rate by about 5-10 fps.

data.title: ImplementEnumType Clean up, removed spaces from the enum types
data.body:
Example
   { TSStatic::CollisionMesh, "Collision Mesh", "Specifically designated \"collision\" meshes." },

was changed to

   { TSStatic::CollisionMesh, "Collision_Mesh", "Specifically designated \"collision\" meshes." },

Updated all the templates as well.

data.title: Post effect fix(renaming function isenabled to get enabled)
data.body: Their was a function and a member function with the same signature, even though it works in TorqueScript it is very bad programming syntax.  I renamed the function to GetEnabled and updated the script to reflect the changes.

data.title: "WayPointTeam"  (Removing it from the code base)
data.body: Removed the code from the branch

data.title: Trigger fix
data.body: updated the vector parse logic so Vector 1 and 2 are read and written in the same order

data.title: Shape image fix
data.body: Removed Duplicate definition of "CorrectMuzzleVector" from shapeImage.cpp

data.title: Shape base correct muzzle vector (Removed Duplicate Declaration)
data.body: Was defined twice.

data.title: Fixed Reversing of order of vectors
data.body: The order the vectors were written and read in got reversed, just put them in the same order.

data.title: "WayPointTeam"  (Removing it from the code base)
data.body: Removed all artifacts to the "WayPointTeam" object.  including masks.,

data.title: Issue with Glow using Stereo Rendering - Rift Valley and Oculus Rift Support.
data.body:
Glow shader glitches on stereo rendering like the one seen in the Rift Valley demo. It's exactly like this issue we are having: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/131991

Steps to Repeat:
1. Open the rift valley demo
2. Select an object and set glow on the texture.
3. See it with stereo rendering.
![stereoGlow](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/4163757/382580/93e17e12-a5fc-11e2-8f62-3c9af0236d89.jpg)

data.title: GuiObjectView TorqueScript setRotation method
data.body: GuiObjectView is a little bare in the realm of script features, making it useless in many cases. This patch allow to set the camera angle on it's orbit, in relation to the object, instead of relying on the hardcoded default.

data.title: Added the ability to set the camera angle on guiObjectView elements
data.body: This modification allow to set the guiObjectView camera angle using a new parameter called cameraRotation i thought that this was sorely missing.

data.title: some small patches
data.body: some variable initialization issues and moved the logging further up so the subsystems can log things earlier. Its actually logging into void by default as the logfile was not created yet.

data.title: River tool defaults to an invalid Cubemap.
data.body: Suggested fix is to have it point to an empty field.  The user can still select the appropriate cubemap for the level as normal.

data.title: Groundcover doesn't take terrain's rotation into account
data.body:
First reported here:  http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/130421

Groundcover does not take into account if the terrain block has been rotated.  The ground cover may appear in the proper shape of the terrain (floating in the air), but not at the terrain itself.

Any terrain should work to test.

In the .MIS file, this value works correctly:
   **rotation = "1 0 0 0";**

This one does does not work correctly:
   **rotation = "0 0 1 115.801";**

It may also be seen by laying down a heavy ground cover and rotating the terrain manually.  Fying around will still update the ground cover, but in the wrong position. This does not seem to happen when moving the terrain along the XYZ axis (not rotated).

data.title: Remove unused and duplicate sounds.
Remove unused weapon scripts in Full Template
data.body:
soldiergun.cs
grenadeLauncher.cs
rocketLauncher.cs

These scripts defined functionality that is not implemented for any of the current weapons.

data.title: Add a new Terrain brush action:  Smooth Slope.
data.body: This smoothes the terrain using a linear regression algorithm, which allows easier creation of slopes.  Exists alongside the oldstyle height averaging action -- options are good!

data.title: Oculus VR (Rift) support
data.body: Input device and shaders for supporting the Oculus Rift.

data.title: Game cam and eye banking, control schemes
data.body:
- ShapeBaseData has two new properties.  cameraCanBank indicates that the game object may bank its eye/camera, if supported by the object. mountedImagesBank indicates that mounted images should bank with the eye/camera in first person view.  Both default to false.
- Player supports 1st person eye and 3rd person camera banking when making use of the new ExtendedMove class.
- Camera class supports banking when making use of the new ExtendedMove class.
- GameConnection now has an idea of a control scheme.  This determines how game objects should respond to input events.  A control scheme may be set by either the server or client.  Current control schemes are:
  -- Absolute rotation (likely though the ExtendedMove class)
  -- Add relative yaw (from mouse or gamepad) to absolute rotation.
  -- Add relative pitch (from mouse or gamepad) to absolute rotation.
- Player class supports the new control schemes when using the ExtendedMove class.
- Camera class supports the new control scheme when using the ExtendedMove class.

data.title: Side by side rendering
data.body:
- Side by side rendering implemented throughout the graphics pipeline.
- New GuiTSCtrl renderStyle property is set to "stereo side by side" to activate.
- You set an IDisplayDevice on the GameConnection to define any vertical FOV, projection offset, and stereo eye offset properties required for the stereo rendering (no display device included with this commit).
- Full and Empty templates updated with correct scripts and shaders.

data.title: Use correct dragCoefficient value in TeleportFlash
Correct customProfiles.cs execution.
data.body:
This removes a duplicate and erroneous attempt to load the customProfiles.cs script.  Also added additional commentary to note that this file is the default save location when using the Gui Editor to create GuiProfiles.
Also fixes a problem where the Empty Template was not loading customProfiles.cs
